editorialSummary.text: A modern American menu with Mediterranean influences is served in a sprawling, wood-accented space.

originalText.text: Asset is hands down our city favorite â€“ delicious food, amazing drinks, and vibes that are just unmatched. Their new menu is also super creative. originalText.text: Came on a Saturday night with a reservation and the place was very lively with a dj. We didnâ€™t like that we booked a high seat table but were seated upstairs in the dining area by the hostess. But nonetheless we had a great time here, the food was amazing but the drinks are ok, we found that that the drinks didnâ€™t taste like what the description sounds like ex; the spicy drinks. But we had a great time overall, will definitely be back, just hope we get the seating we reserved for next time

originalText.text: We did New Yearâ€™s Eve party here and they did such a great job! They had finger food and sushi all night and great drinks. The service was amazing and they had great entertainment with a DJ and dancers. I really enjoyed my time here!

originalText.text:
Let me start by saying this is one of the MOST GORGEOUS restaurants Iâ€™ve been to !! The moment you walk in you know youâ€™re going to have a great time the music is upbeat and current and the lighting sets the mood !!
The food is sooooo good especially the crispy tuna rice and shishito peppers !! The sushi is super fresh and flavorful too we loved literally every dish we tried!!
The drinks are spot on too especially their plum sangria different from other sangrias Iâ€™ve tried itâ€™s my favorite version !!
So get dressed up and expect to have a great time

originalText.text:
ASSET is a great spot on the UWS. It seems to have recent rebranded and Iâ€™m loving it. The ambiance and drinks really steal the show for me. The interior is gorgeous and moody, almost like youâ€™re being transported downtown or overseas. Happy Hour is M-F from 4-6pm and offers $10 select bites, $10 cocktails, and discounts on wine and beer.

Drinks: the drinks are pretty stellar. As a fan of tequila, I lean towards the Sizzling Peach and the Ube Rockinâ€™ which are both delicious. Both are vibrant with a tasty rim.

Food: the food here is good, there are definitely some standouts, but I wouldnâ€™t necessarily say the best part of the experience. The potstickers, spicy tuna crispy rice, and Japanese yakimishi fried rice are amazing. The fried rice has a great bit of crunch from the bacon and is a healthy portion size. Potstickers come in a delicious sauce and are incredibly juicy. The rock shrimp tempura was disappointing for a seafood fan. The breading overpowers the shrimp and leaves you feeling like you could find it in a frozen bag. The cauliflower was similarly breaded but the fry and flavor were much better. The eggrolls are good but a small portion for the price. Brussels sprouts are great, pretty standard. There are some great dishes and some misses, but overall the pricing is a little steep for what youâ€™re getting.

Ambiance: the ambiance here is so so good. The music is great, the lighting is perfect, and the decor is magical. Itâ€™s sexy and sleek, perfect for a date or a group of friends on a night out.

Service: Amazing service all around. Bartenders (Jerome and othersâ€¦ unsure of their names) are all super friendly and helpful. Wait staff is similarly accommodating and knowledgeable.

Come to ASSET for the happy hour or to have a drink at the bar, grab a couple of snacks, and enjoy the vibe. Alternatively, impress a date with their great atmosphere and a few great bites.
